key_title: Key to the species of Diuris

breadcrumbs.key_title: Key to the main groups of plants in Victoria
Key to the families of Monocotyledons
Key to the families in the Asparagales-Liliales complex
Key to the genera of Orchidaceae

leads.lead_text: Lateral sepals >30 mm long
Lateral sepals <25 mm long
Flowers predominantly yellow, with some white and purplish markings on the labellum
Flowers predominantly purple, lilac or white
Flowers white with purple markings
Flowers purple with darker markings (rarely entirely white)
Lateral sepals >60mm long on mature plants; plants often >30 cm tall; flowers late November to early December; north-east Victoria
Lateral sepals to 60 mm long; plants to 30 cm tall; flowers October to late November; southern Victoria
Flowers mostly white with some pale mauve markings; flowers from October to early November; grasslands immediately west of Melbourne
Flowers white or pale mauve with copious darker lilac blotches; flowers mostly November; grasslands near Bairnsdale
Flowers mauve to purple; labellum with a short neck between mid-lobe and lateral lobes; petal claws to 6 mm long; widespread
Flowers dark purple; labellum with a long neck between mid-lobe and lateral lobes; petal claws >6 mm long; confined to western Victoria
Lateral lobes of labellum much shorter and narrower than mid-lobe
Lateral lobes of labellum similar in length and breadth to mid-lobe
Flowers white to cream-yellow with maroon to brownish striations or blotches on inner and outer surface; montane river valleys
Flowers bright yellow to orange, sometimes with darker striations or blotches on inner and outer surface
Plants often robust, to 50 cm tall; dorsal sepal proportionately large, to 20 mm long, often heavily striated
Plants usually slender, to 35 cm tall; dorsal sepal to 15 mm long, not heavily striated
At least some plants forming dense clumps by vegetative propagation; often in grasslands of western Victoria
Plants usually solitary
Flowers bright golden yellow, often with a darker orange labellum callus, porrect to semi-nodding, not opening widely; grasslands immediately west of Melbourne
Flowers uniformly bright yellow, porrect to semi-erect, usually opening widely; grasslands and grassy woodlands west of Melbourne
Labellum mid-lobe with prominent dark striae, a thick extensive callus and the central part heavily marked with tan-brown resembling a stain; known only from Wycheproof and Swan Hill
Labellum mid-lobe not as above
Labellum lamina on a long prominent basal claw
Labellum lamina on a short basal claw
Flowers October to December; montane to subalpine areas
Flowers August to September; grasslands of northern Victoria
Flowers erect, labellum and lateral sepals directed upwards
Flowers porrect to nodding, labellum and lateral sepals directed horizontally or downwards
Labellum callus a pair of basal ridges; labellum mid-lobe flat, fan-shaped
Labellum callus a single central ridge; labellum mid-lobe more or less ovate
Petals 3.5–7 mm wide; flowers mostly September and October; lowland habitats to 800 metres
Petals 4–9 mm wide; flowers mostly November to January; highland habitats over 800 metres
Leaves linear and channelled, 1–3 per plant; flowers more than 20 mm across
Leaves thread-like and usually twisted, 8 or more per plant; flowers to about 20 mm across
Labellum callus a pair of basal ridges; lateral sepals usually strongly crossed
Labellum callus a single central ridge; lateral sepals usually more or less parallel
Labellum lobes of similar length, callus extending only on to base of mid-lobe; flowers usually yellow with bold red, pink or brownish markings
Labellum mid-lobe about twice as long as side lobes, callus extending well on to lamina of mid-lobe; flowers bright yellow with two prominent brownish blotches on base of dorsal sepal
